intro: Corylus heterophylla, commonly known as the variable hazelnut, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its alternate, simple, and often serrated leaves that vary in shape and size along the stem. The plant produces catkins in early spring, followed by edible坚果 that mature in the fall. Its leaves are typically alternate and can range from ovate to lanceolate in shape. Corylus heterophylla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
